title: Publications
description: Essential operational publications, their contents, and when they should be consulted by staff

flashcards.question: How are you kept up-to-date with publication changes?
flashcards.answer: The PON updates the sectional appendix and any changes to the rule book. Also receive briefings from managers and STUD days.

flashcards.question: How can you access information regarding the rule book and c2c appendices?
flashcards.answer: Rule books are kept in driver managers offices. Rule books and appendices can be found on the c2c intranet, RSSB website.

flashcards.question: Explain contents of the WTT and when you would need to refer to it?
flashcards.answer: Check passing time if fast service to ensure you are not late or too early and could get held at red signals, check for train departure / arrival times. 1- Fast train, Arr - arrival time [2] engineering time extra allowance. 2- All stations, Dep - departure time (2) pathing time. 3- Freight / staff train, + - ECS time <2> performance time. 5 - ECS, 9 - Special service.

flashcards.question: Explain the principle sections of the STN and when you would need to refer to it?
flashcards.answer: Alterations to WTT, planned sporting / music events, planned engineering works, closures of other lines, ticket acceptance from other lines, additional dispatch requirements.

flashcards.question: Explain the principle sections of the WON and when you would need to refer to it?
flashcards.answer: Safety notices, Section A - Temporary speed restrictions, Section B - Engineering arrangements, Section C - Signalling and permanent way alterations, Section D - General instructions and notices, Multi SPAD signals.

flashcards.question: Explain the sections of the PON and when you would need to refer to it?
flashcards.answer: Part 1 items new to PON, (not posted before in WON have thick black line in margin). Part 2 items previously published in the PON but still current, (items published for the last time marked with 3 * if relevant take note). AR2 updates to sectional appendix.

flashcards.question: What publication can you find information on line speed?
What is the purpose of the Weekly Operating Notice (WON)?
flashcards.answer: To provide weekly updates about temporary speed restrictions, engineering arrangements, signaling changes, and other important operational information.

flashcards.question: What is the purpose of the Periodical Operating Notice (PON)?
flashcards.answer: To provide updates to the sectional appendix, publish rule book changes, and maintain a record of instructions that remain in effect longer than the weekly notices.

flashcards.question: What is the purpose of the Special Traffic Notice (STN)?
flashcards.answer: To provide information about special events, engineering works, line closures, and other temporary arrangements that affect normal operations.

flashcards.question: What is the purpose of the Working Time Table (WTT)?
flashcards.answer: To provide the scheduled times for trains including departure, arrival, and passing times at stations and timing points.

flashcards.question: How is new information indicated in the PON?
flashcards.answer: Items new to the PON (not posted before in WON) have a thick black line in the margin.

flashcards.question: How are items that are being published for the last time in the PON indicated?
flashcards.answer: Items published for the last time are marked with 3 asterisks (*).
